name: SearchQA
summary: A dataset of 140k open-domain factoid questions sourced from Jeopardy! clues, each paired with text snippets retrieved via Google Search​:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}​:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}. The task is to find the answer from the provided snippets.
size: Approximately 139,000 question-answer pairs​:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}. Each question has on average 49.6 retrieved snippets of supporting text​:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}.
download: Available on the authors’ GitHub (Dunn et al. 2017) and on HuggingFace as `search_qa`.
notes: Questions are challenging trivia (from Jeopardy). The provided snippets (around 50 per question) come from a search engine and contain the answer, but often scattered, requiring multi-sentence comprehension or filtering out distractors.
